messageValues.message:
=You are an expert social media and LinkedIn content writer. But you must follow all the instructions under the Theme, Tone, and Formatting sections. 


You will be provided with following details about the "My Briefcase" project
- Project Significance
- Pitch Deck
- Project Proposal


**Task:**
Using the information above, generate the content for a LinkedIn post:
- Limit to 1300 characters.
- Ensure your output is positive, professional, clear, and follows all provided instructions and feedback.
- write a polished, professionally worded LinkedIn post suitable for sharing. 
- Strictly follow the instructions and ensure the message is engaging and succinct.
- Add a call to action or particular phrase (for example, "Connect with me" at the bottom), if appropriate.


- Do NOT include any explanations, just the final post content only, ready to publish on LinkedIn.
- Do NOT use word "Our". Everything is done by me alone. I am a One-Gal-Shop (OGS) after all!
- Do NOT include any explanations, markdown, headings, or commentaryâ€”just the post text, ready to copy and share on LinkedIn.



## Instructions:
1. Theme:
- Generate a short post related to the Engineering Strategy or Roadmap, using the Technical Updates and Project Proposal content

2. Tone
- Keep the tone cheerful, casual, positive, inclusive, and professional.
- Provide a casual snippy Title for the post

3. Formatting:
- Add relevant hashtags in small case.
- Include the correct Day in the post
- Limit the content to within 1300 characters.
- Place the call to action or special instruction at the end if requested.
- Output ONLY the final LinkedIn post content. 
- Use emojis where appropriate
- Use bullet points where appropriate and use a green checkmark at the start

json.content:
Hereâ€™s a 10-week Sales, Marketing, and Outreach strategy for My Briefcase, tailored to your build-in-public journey as a solo founder, covering:
ğŸ¯ Weekly concrete steps
ğŸ’¼ LinkedIn post themes
ğŸ¥ YouTube video update ideas
ğŸ—“ï¸ Weekly Strategy Overview: Sales, Marketing & Outreach
ğŸ¯ Your Goal This Quarter:
Build visibility and credibility
Connect with property managers, vendors, and potential tenants
Generate feedback loops
Begin building a waitlist or early adopter pool


ğŸŒŸ 10-Week Sales, Marketing & Outreach Plan for My Briefcase
ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 1: Ground Zero â€“ Introduce Yourself & the Problem
Steps:
Finalize your landing page
Set up a newsletter signup form
Draft your 1-line pitch and vision statement
LinkedIn Post:
Introduce My Briefcase + your story as a solo founder
Share your mission and motivation (layoffs, resilience, building from scratch)
YouTube:
Share why youâ€™re building My Briefcase
Explain what vertical AI means and how it applies to property management

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 2: Define Your Audience & Research
Steps:
Create ICPs: solo/small PM teams, vendors, owners
Conduct 3â€“5 interviews with property managers/vendors
Join property management Facebook/Slack/Reddit groups
LinkedIn Post:
Ask the community: â€œWhatâ€™s broken in your property management process?â€
YouTube:
Recap of your audience research, lessons learned from initial interviews

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 3: Build Trust & Start Collecting Emails
Steps:
Offer a free resource: â€œTop 10 Problems in PM + How AI Can Solve Themâ€
Share this in all the groups and on LinkedIn
Start collecting warm leads via Notion or Airtable CRM
LinkedIn Post:
Drop your free resource (link to landing page), ask for feedback
YouTube:
Walkthrough of the resource and the insights behind it

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 4: Behind the Scenes â€“ Build in Public
Steps:
Share early UI/UX sketches or a system diagram
Build your first workflow (e.g. â€œAutomated Listing to Zillowâ€)
LinkedIn Post:
Screenshot + story of the weekâ€™s build + lesson learned
YouTube:
Demo the automated listing workflow + what tools you used

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 5: Outreach & Partnerships â€“ Start Conversations
Steps:
DM property managers who liked/commented
Set up 1:1 calls with at least 5 people
Build a database of 50 potential contacts
LinkedIn Post:
Ask: â€œAre you a small PM team that wants better tools? Letâ€™s talk!â€
YouTube:
Share your outreach strategy + how those convos are shaping the product

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 6: Early Access â€“ Waitlist Campaign
Steps:
Launch early access/waitlist
Offer incentives for joining: early features, 1:1 support, etc.
LinkedIn Post:
â€œWaitlist is live! Be the first to shape how this platform grows.â€
YouTube:
Devlog update: features complete + whatâ€™s coming next

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 7: Vendor + Investor Network Outreach
Steps:
Post in vendor/service provider groups (cleaners, plumbers, etc.)
Reach out to angel investors interested in vertical SaaS/AI
LinkedIn Post:
â€œCalling vendors and investorsâ€”letâ€™s create an ecosystem together.â€
YouTube:
Talk about the vision for a trusted vendor network + monetization model

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 8: Live Demo + First Customer Validation
Steps:
Run a live demo with 3â€“5 early users
Capture testimonials or quotes
LinkedIn Post:
Screenshot of demo, ask: â€œWant to join the next one?â€
YouTube:
Record highlights of the demo, user reactions, and feedback

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 9: Iterate Based on Feedback
Steps:
Prioritize feedback from early users
Release a small improvement/fix weekly
LinkedIn Post:
â€œYou asked for this â†’ hereâ€™s the fix! Iâ€™m listening.â€
YouTube:
Devlog: how user feedback reshaped your roadmap

ğŸ—“ï¸ Week 10: Share the Vision Forward
Steps:
Publish your public roadmap on your landing page
Share your next 3-month goals
Plan your next growth channel (ads, SEO, podcast guesting)
LinkedIn Post:
Your 10-week recap + lessons learned + vision forward ğŸ’¥
YouTube:
Honest reflection video: highs, lows, whatâ€™s next

ğŸ›  Suggested Tools
CRM: Airtable/Notion
Forms & Surveys: Tally.so or Typeform
Landing Page: Typedream or Next.js + Vercel
Newsletter: Beehiiv, ConvertKit, or Substack
Outreach: DM tracker + Google Sheet
Email Automation: MailerLite or ConvertKit
Community: Discord or Slack (future)

May 2025
Post as Afshan: What Am I building
ğŸš€ Iâ€™m building a product and a business - bootstrapped, solo, and from the ground up - as part of my One Gal Shop (OGS) consulting journey.
ğŸ’¡ This project is personal. Itâ€™s my way of learning by doing, practicing perseverance, and proving that with focus and resilience, you can build something out of nothing.
ğŸ—ï¸ Itâ€™s also about creating real impact: âœ… A vertical AI platform âœ… For small property management teams âœ… That simplifies operations and helps them scale with ease
âœ¨ Iâ€™m not just building software,  Iâ€™m building a brand, a business, and a future.
If you want to learn with me, cheer me on, or just watch it all unfoldâ€”follow along.
ğŸ’ª Iâ€™m here, Iâ€™m doing it, and I will build this, one day, one feature, one conversation at a time!

#SoloFounder #OGS #BuildInPublic #Resilience #AI #SaaS #PropertyTech

Post as OGS: How Am I building it 
ğŸš¨ Project Reveal Time ğŸš¨
As part of my solo consulting initiative - One Gal Shop - the very first project Iâ€™m working on is for myself.
Introducing The Briefcase ğŸ§³ â€” a Vertical AI platform for Property Management.
This is more than just a web app. Itâ€™s a full-cycle journey into entrepreneurship.
While building The Briefcase, Iâ€™m wearing all the hats: ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’¼ Business Owner ğŸ“¦ Product Owner ğŸ§  Project Manager ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Engineer ğŸ“£ Marketer ğŸ¤ Outreach & Partnerships
Iâ€™m not just writing code. Iâ€™m building the product and engineering roadmaps, finding real customers, connecting with vendors, and laying the foundation for something biggerâ€”a real, resilient solo business.
ğŸ’¬ If youâ€™re a property manager or a vendor in this space, I want to hear from you. Your insight is gold. Letâ€™s talk.
ğŸ’¼ If youâ€™re an investor, watch my journey unfold. Follow along and decide for yourself.
ğŸŒ± This is just the beginning. Stay tuned for the landing page drop and all the updates as I build in public.
#VerticalAI #SoloFounder #OGS #TheBriefcase #BuildInPublic #PropertyTech #WomenInTech #SaaS #AI #StartupJourney



June 2025
Post as Afshan: What does it mean for me
ğŸ‘‹ Hi, Iâ€™m Afshanâ€”solo founder of One Gal Shop (OGS).
ğŸ—ï¸ Iâ€™m building a vertical AI-powered platform to simplify property managementâ€”from listings to move-outsâ€”one workflow at a time.
âœ¨ This is my part-time passion project, but itâ€™s full-time in ambition. To make my mark, I wear all the hats:
ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’» Tech lead
ğŸ§  Product owner
ğŸ“ˆ Business builder
ğŸ“£ Marketing
ğŸ’¼ Partnerships
ğŸ’¸ Investor outreach
Iâ€™m building this platform in public, to help me learn by doing, stay focused, and to help small and solo property management shops (typically 1â€“5 team members):
âœ… Save time
âœ… Reduce stress
âœ… Scale operations
âœ… Deliver better renter experiences using automation + AI
ğŸ“š This journey is about resilience, learning by doing, and turning an idea into a product that serves real people.
ğŸ” Follow alongâ€”this is just the beginning.
#BuildInPublic #VerticalAI #SoloFounder #SaaS #PropertyTech #WomenInTech #StartupJourney #Resilience #Automation

Post as OGS: Who is it for
For my project â€œThe Briefcaseâ€, ğŸ¯ My target users are property managers like youâ€”wearing every hat, juggling everything, and still delivering great experiences to renters with limited bandwidth.
ğŸ¤ This is a call to collaborate:
ğŸ¡ Property Owners â€” Want smarter, hands-off property management? Letâ€™s talk. ğŸ§â€â™‚ï¸ Tenants â€” What does a better rental experience look like to you? Iâ€™m building it with you in mind. ğŸ¢ Property Management Teams â€” Help shape this product with your feedback. Letâ€™s build something actually useful. ğŸ”§ Vendors (plumbers, cleaners, inspectors, etc.) â€” Letâ€™s partner up and create an ecosystem of trusted providers. ğŸ’¸ Investors â€” If you're interested in vertical AI and early-stage SaaS, my inbox is open.

ğŸ“£ Iâ€™ll be sharing progress, insights, and product drops along the way.
Follow along. Cheer me on. Letâ€™s build the future of property managementâ€”together.
#BuildInPublic #VerticalAI #SoloFounder #SaaS #PropertyTech #WomenInTech #StartupJourney #Resilience #Automation



July 2025
Post as Afshan: Why am I doing it?
ğŸ’¥ So what pushed me to start this? Pain. And purpose.
At my last job, I watched my entire teamâ€”my friends, my colleaguesâ€”get laid off, one by one. Then it was my turn. It deeply affected me. I was heartbrokenâ€”not just for myself and my teammates, but for the way it happened, the bad decisions which led to that, the over-promise, under-deliver pattern.
But I donâ€™t want to feel like that ever again, and this is my way of transforming that experience. Iâ€™m choosing to grow, to persevere, and to build. Doing projects like this keeps me productive, focused, and resilient. It pulls me out of stagnation and into action. It replaces helplessness with ownershipâ€”and despair with creativity.
ğŸŒ± Iâ€™m building something that lasts. Something I control. To stand tall in uncertain economies and proveâ€”to myself, and maybe to othersâ€”that resilience is more than a mindset. Itâ€™s showing up. Itâ€™s taking action. Itâ€™s doing the work.
ğŸ“£ So Iâ€™m building a product.ğŸ“£ Iâ€™m building a business.ğŸ“£ Iâ€™m building me.
Itâ€™s scary. But itâ€™s real. And itâ€™s mine.
If youâ€™ve been through someâ€”I see you.Letâ€™s survive and thriveâ€”together.
#Resilience #BuildInPublic #SoloFounder #OGS #ComebackStory #LayoffsToLeadership #PropertyTech #FounderJourney #WomenInTech #VerticalAI


Post as OGS: What is the shift?
ğŸ”¥ The Big Shift: From SaaS to Agentic Platforms
In the traditional SaaS model: ğŸ–¥ï¸ Users log in ğŸ“Š Navigate dashboards ğŸ§© Input data ğŸ”„ Manually run workflows
In the agentic model: ğŸ¤– You delegate to an AI agent ğŸ§  It understands your intent ğŸ›  Executes complex workflows behind the scenes âœ… Delivers outcomesâ€”or asks for clarification

This changes everything:
âœ¨ Users donâ€™t want dashboards. They want results.
âš¡ Speed matters. Agents do in seconds what used to take minutes or hours.
ğŸ«¥ SaaS is becoming invisible. The best software will feel like a conversation, not an interface.
This is the future I'm building forâ€”agent-first, outcome-focused, human-friendly software.
Are you shifting too? Letâ€™s connect.
#AgenticAI #SaaS #ProductDesign #BuildInPublic #VerticalAI #AIUX #TheBriefcase #OGS #FutureOfWork






August 2025
Post as Afshan: ?
Iâ€™m Afshan, a solo founder wearing every hat: product owner, idea architect, tech lead, business builder, revenue generator, and investor whisperer.
This journey is raw, real, and relentless. Iâ€™m learning by doing, building something out of nothingâ€”and sharing everything in public.
Follow along if you believe in resilience, reinvention, and reimagining whatâ€™s possible with AI.

Post as OGS: The evolution
ğŸŒ€ Redefining SaaS: The Rise of Agentic Platforms
The SaaS model as we know it is undergoing a seismic shift.
AI isnâ€™t just a feature anymore. Itâ€™s not just helping us use software,  ğŸ‘‰ğŸ½ Itâ€™s replacing the traditional software experience altogether.
Weâ€™re moving from UI-driven interactionsâ€”dashboards, forms, buttonsâ€”to agentic experiences, where intelligent agents understand intent, automate workflows, and deliver outcomes directly.
But hereâ€™s the paradox:
ğŸ› ï¸ The architectural backbone of SaaSâ€” secure multi-tenancy, data isolation, permissioning, auditability, workflow orchestrationâ€” is more important than ever.
Weâ€™re not abandoning SaaS. Weâ€™re evolving it.
If you're building in this spaceâ€”letâ€™s connect.If you're curiousâ€”follow along.If you're a vendor, property manager, or investorâ€”letâ€™s talk.
#AgenticAI #VerticalSaaS #FutureOfSaaS #BuildInPublic #AIUX #AIInfrastructure #PropertyTech #OneGalShop #TheBriefcase #WomenInTech

Weekly content plan that focuses on you as a solo founder and emphasizes your personal journey in building the AI platform. The tone will highlight your progress, the challenges youâ€™re facing, and your achievements, all while keeping it casual and engaging for your audience.

output.title: Weekend Meme Break: Neurodivergent Founder Life ğŸ§
output.content:
Saturday vibes: When you're a neurodivergent solo founder and your brain treats every weekend like a bonus work day ğŸ¤¯

Me: "I'll just check one thing on my project..."
Also me: *3 hours later still coding* "Wait, what day is it?"

ğŸ§  Being autistic in the founder world means:
âœ… Hyperfocus = feature development superpowers
âœ… Pattern recognition = spotting market gaps others miss
âœ… Attention to detail = building quality products
âœ… Direct communication = no fluff, just value

Sure, I might forget to eat lunch while debugging, but I also built an entire AI workflow in one sitting because my brain said "this is interesting" ğŸš€

Neurodiversity isn't a bugâ€”it's a feature. And I'm building my startup to prove it.

Who else has weekend "rest" that looks suspiciously like productive obsession? ğŸ˜…

Connect with me if you're building differently too!
